results.title: Ted Baryluk's grocery
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig, Michael Scott, John Paskievich and Mike Mirus
results.brief_description: Ukranian-Canadian Ted Baryluk’s grocery store has been a fixture in Winnipeg’s north end for over 20 years. In this black and white photo study, Ted talks about his store, the customers who have come and gone, and the social changes his multi-cultural neighbourhood has seen. But most of all he wonders what will become of his store when he retires. He hopes his daughter Helen will take over, but she wants to move away. The film is a wistful rendering of a shopkeeper’s relationship with his daughter and a fascinating portrait of a neighbourhood and its inhabitants. (Awards: Yorkton, Chicago, Toronto)

results.title: Tectonics
results.creator_credit: Yorkshire Television, European Broadcasting Union and Ian Rosenbloom
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Planet Earth”.
Program 1 of a 4 part series. Each program is divided into sections for easy classroom viewing using a combination of the latest computer graphics and filmed examples of climatic occurrences to provide a detailed description and explanation of the geographical factors influencing Planet Earth. This video aims to provide a detailed description and explanation of the structure of the earth; plate tectonics; earthquakes at destructive and conservative margins; collision zones; fold mountains; and volcanoes. Includes a teacher’s guide.

results.title: Technology for the 1972 Olympic Games
results.brief_description: To carry out such a world event as the 1972 Olympic Games in Munich, a wide range of the most modern technical devices were necessary. The film highlights some of the technical achievements of the Games, in which Siemens Industries played an important technical role.

results.title: Technology at work (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: TVC London, Riverfront Pictures and Chris Thomas
results.brief_description: Technological innovations have radically changed the workplace and this video examines the way that they have changed the role of workers, whether by loss of jobs or a change in work methods. Factory, office and retail employees are questioned about how the changes were introduced, whether they were given adequate training and the effect it has had on them.

results.title: Techno
results.brief_description: Presented in a magazine-style fomat, with excellent pupil notes, “Techno” aims to stimulate 11-14 years olds in the areas of design and technology. Using a problem-solving approach, with “real world” examples, the programs give necessary background information and guidance on how to solve these. Curriculum areas covered by these programs include graphic communication, woodcraft, textiles, materials such as plastic and metal, and basic engineering concepts.

results.title: Techniques of the skilled driver
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safe Driving”.
An instructor in a driver-training course uses the experiences of a former student in explaining that proper practice and a correct attitude are essential in the development of a skilled driver.

results.title: Techniques of swimming
results.creator_credit: Department of Education, Queensland, Paul Quinlan and Ruth Irons
results.brief_description: Bill Sweetenham, head coach, and Joe King, assistant coach of the Australian team at the Moscow Olympics, lecture on long distance swimmming and discuss stroke techniques and advanced drills. BEST SUITED TO COACHES AND TEACHERS.

results.title: Techniques of paper sculpture
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the basic techniques of paper sculpture - the cut, bend, fold and score - and their application in making a mask and a party favour. Shows commercial applications in window sets, art posters, and stage sets.
